results.title: Australian environment: South West Australia
results.brief_description: From ancient times the south east corner of the continent has been isolated by seas on one side and the arid inland plains on the other. Many strange plants and animals have survived in this area and evolved striking characteristics. This film is a brief visit to this living museum of natural wonders found in the south west of Australia.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 135
results.brief_description: Magazine items: Coleambally irrigation area, N.S.W.: Water has brought good production and harvests to farms which were once barren wildernesses; Albert Park: Five hundred and seventy acres of Melbourne parkland are put to good use; a large lake, parklands, sporting areas, buildings and a restaurant. No other credits available.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 134
results.brief_description: Magazine items: Bush Hostel: the dingo-proof fence which runs along the border of New South Wales, Queensland and South Australia is patrolled and repaired. The Todd family live on the job and the three children have been taught by correspondence but are now able to attend school for the first time. Tea and Sugar Train: Fifty maintenance camps are scattered along the Trans Continental Railway which runs along the Nullabor Plain. Weekly trains bring essential supplies and news to families at these lonely outposts. No other credits available.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 133
results.brief_description: Magazine items: Heron sailing, Canberra. A poetic glimpse of Heron class yachts on Lake Burley Griffin; Pre-school kindergarten. A day at a kindergarten at which many children obviously enjoy facilities available under the supervision of trained staff; Modern dance. At the Fort Street Girls’ High School in Sydney, Modern dance is part of the physical education programme and many students enjoy these sessions. No other credits available.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 131
results.brief_description: Magazine items: Mobile classroom N.S.W. A fully equipped train with classrooms and an instructor who lives aboard travels around the rural centres of N.S.W. giving technical training to people of all ages. Football Grand Final - Melbourne. In Victoria, Australian Rules Football is the most popular winter sport. Briefly explains the game and shows the Grand Final Match between Geelong and Richmond. No other credits available.
